intro: Impatiens tianlinensis, commonly known as the Tianlin Impatiens, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Balsaminaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that typically come in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical studies.
